short_summary: Implementation of Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) for three junior application services testers, Level 3 senior project manager, and Level 2 intermediate project manager
description: NOTICE OF PROPOSED PROCUREMENT FOR TASK-BASED INFORMATICS PROFESSIONAL SERVICES FOR THE CANADIAN ARMED FORCES MILITARY JUSTICE SYSTEM
tags: Système de gestion de la garantie
Mis en œuvre | Resourcement des professionnels en informatiques/projets
full_summary:
__procurement-notice__
**Identification Number**: W6369-23-X045/A
**Amendment Number**: 3
**Request for Proposal (RFP)**: for Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS)
**Unspsc Code**: *80101600*: Project management, *81110000*: Computer services
**GSIN Code**: D302A - Informatics Professional Services
**Solicitation Number**: W6369-23-X045/A

**Pre-Proposal Information**

* Notice publication date: 2023-09-07
* Tender closing date: 2023-09-29 14:00:00
* Tender status: Expired

**Solicitation Description**

The Department of National Defence, Director Services Contracting (DISC) is seeking a qualified TBIPS holder to provide services for the level 1 test engineers (A11), level 2 and 3 project managers (P9).

The objective of this procurement is to ensure the provision of high-quality services to support the testing, integration and rollout of JAG information and administration system (SGIAJ) at SDN/CAF.

* Three (3) Junior Application Services Testers to support the testing, integration, and rollout of SGIAJ within DND/CAF
* One (1) Level 3 Senior Project Manager to manage the continued development and implementation of SGIAJ, using a comprehensive roadmap plan that maximizes existing budgetary and human resource allocations aligned to identified business requirements provided by the TA.
* One (1) Level 2 Intermediate Project Manager to manage OJAG support to military justice statutory and regulatory reform projects, using a comprehensive roadmap plan that maximizes budgetary and human resources aligned to identified business requirements provided by the TA.

**Business Requirements**

The qualified TBIPS holder must meet the following requirements:

* Hold a Protected B level security clearance
* Reliability status
* Demonstrated expertise and experience in providing similar services.

**Selecting Criteria**

The evaluation of proposals will be based on a combined rating of technical merit and price.

**Trade Agreements**

The procurement is open to bidders from countries with which Canada has a trade agreement.

**Documentation**

Bidder’s must submit their proposal electronically to the designated email address.

**Proposal Requirements**

The proposal must include a completion date for each service type requested, as well as a comprehensive roadmap plan outlining proposed methodology, timelines and resources required.

**Contract Administration Information**

Contracting authority: Rogelio Orsetti,
